split.label: Split
split.description: Split a PDF into multiple files.
split.inputHint: Enter a comma-separated list of page numbers: 4,7,12-16
split.info:
The numbers you select are the page number you wish to do a split on. 

As such selecting 1,3,7-9 would split a 10 page document into 6 separate PDFs with: 

Document #1: Page 1
Document #2: Page 2, 3
Document #3: Page 4-7
Document #4: Page 8
Document #5: Page 9
Document #6: Page 10

remove.label: Remove
remove.description: Remove specific pages from your PDF.
remove.inputHint: Enter a comma-separated list of page numbers: 4,7,12-16

extract.label: Extract Pages
extract.description: Extract selected pages from your PDF.
extract.inputHint: Enter a comma-separated list of page numbers: 4,7,12-16

organize.label: Organize
organize.info:
Use a custom sequence of page numbers or expressions to define a new order.

Custom Page Order:
Provide a comma-separated list, e.g., 4,7,12-16 or use functions like 2n+1.

Examples:
4-7,2,13,10-12 → Pages 4 to 7, then page 2, followed by page 13, and finally pages 10 to 12.

Function Explanation:
・n = total number of pages
・2n+1 = all odd-numbered pages
・2n = all even-numbered pages

rotate.label: Rotate
rotate.description: Rotate pages to the correct orientation.
rotate.info:
Select pages to rotate, then use the small ⟲ / ⟳ buttons per page.
You can also batch-rotate using the input. 

Supported syntax:
- Commas or spaces: 1 3 5 or 1,3,5
- Ranges (inclusive): 5-7
- Open-ended ranges: -7 means 1–7, 5- means 5–last page
- All pages: all or *

multi-page.label: Multi-Page Layout
multi-page.description: Merge multiple pages into a single page.

compress.label: Compress
compress.description: Reduce the file size of your PDF.

word.label: Word
word.description: Convert your PDF to editable Word documents.

ppt.label: PPT
ppt.description: Convert your PDF to editable PPT documents.

text.label: Text
text.info:
Choose a text format based on content needs.
Single-file upload only to reduce server load.

TXT: Plain text for simple notes or code;
RTF: Rich text with basic formatting like bold and italics.

html.label: HTML
html.description: Convert your PDF to HTML files.

xml.label: XML
xml.description: Convert your PDF to XML files.

csv.label: CSV
csv.description: Convert your PDF to CSV files.
csv.info:
Extract tables from one selected PDF page and export them as a CSV file for easier analysis and data handling. 

Single-file upload only to reduce server load.

markdown.label: Markdown
markdown.description: Convert your PDF into Markdown format.

add-password.label: Add Password
add-password.description: Protect your PDF with an password.
add-password.info:
Set a password required to open the document. 
This does not restrict editing or printing.

remove-password.label: Remove Password
remove-password.info: Enter the current password to unlock the file.

sign.label: Sign
sign.description: Add signatures to your PDF by drawing, text, or image.
sign.info:
Sign your PDF document using various methods to suit your needs.

Drawing:
Draw your signature directly on the canvas using a mouse or touchscreen.

Text:
Type your name and choose from a selection of fonts to create a professional-looking signature.

Image:
Upload an image file of your handwritten signature (PNG, JPG, BMP) to place it on the document.

sections.imageHint: Upload a PNG or JPG image of your signature

howTo.title: How to add signature
howTo.canvasBody: After drawing your signature in the canvas, close the modal then click anywhere on the PDF to place it.
howTo.imageBody: After uploading your signature image above, click anywhere on the PDF to place it.
howTo.textBody: After entering your name above, click anywhere on the PDF to place your signature.

add-watermark.label: Add Watermark
add-watermark.description: Add a watermark to your PDF.
add-watermark.languageHint: Make sure the selected language matches your watermark text. For English letters, digits, and basic symbols, use Roman.
add-watermark.info:
Add a watermark to your PDF to indicate its status or ownership.

Watermark Type:
Choose between text or image watermarks.

Language:
Select the language for text watermarks to ensure proper rendering and style.

Font Size:
Size of the watermark text in points.
Larger sizes create bigger text.

Rotation:
Angle to rotate the watermark text or image.
Specify in degrees (e.g., 45° for diagonal).

Opacity:
Transparency level of the watermark.
0% is fully transparent, 100% is fully opaque.

Position X/Y:
Coordinates to place the watermark on the page.
Measured in points from the bottom-left corner.

compare.label: Compare
compare.description: Compare the differences between two PDF files.

extract-images.label: Extract Images
extract-images.description: Extract all images from your PDF.

ocr-pdf.label: OCR & Cleanup
ocr-pdf.description: Enhance scanned PDFs with OCR and cleanup.
ocr-pdf.info:
Optical Character Recognition (OCR) helps you turn scanned or screenshotted pages into text you can search, copy, or highlight.

Languages:
Improve OCR accuracy by specifying the expected languages.
Choose one or more languages to guide detection.

OCR Mode:
・Auto skips pages that already contain text layers.
・Force re-OCRs every page and replaces all the text.
・Strict halts if any selectable text is found.

add-page-numbers.label: Add Page Numbers
add-page-numbers.description: Add page numbers to your PDF.
add-page-numbers.info:
Add page numbers to your PDF document to enhance navigation and organization.

Margin Size:
Distance between the page number and the edge of the page.

Font Name:
Font family for the page numbers.
Choose based on your document style.

Font Size:
Size of the page number text in points.
Larger numbers create bigger text.
Defaults to 12, minimum 1.

Starting Number:
The first number to display.
Subsequent pages will increment from this number.
Defaults to 1.

Pages to Number:
Custom page selection.
Enter a comma-separated list of page numbers like 1,5,6 or patterns like 2n+1.

Custom Text Format:
Optional custom format for page numbers.
Use placeholders to dynamically insert values:
{n} = current page number
{total} = total number of pages
{filename} = original filename

Example:
- 'Page {n}' → Page 1, Page 2
- '{filename} - {n}/{total}' → MyFile - 1/10, MyFile - 2/10
